Shares of Bharat-22 Exchange Traded Fund (ETF) rose 3.6 percent on the Bombay Stock Exchange after making their stock market debut at Rs 36.3 apiece on Tuesday.The ETF has a Diversified exposure to various stocks and sectors. At the stock level cap of 15 percent, while there is a sector level cap of 20 percent to the total fund size. The Annual rebalancing for the Bharat 22 ETF shall be done in March, which will ensure that there is no over or under exposure to sectors and stocks that are a part of this ETF.The government has raised Rs 14,500 crore through the open-ended exchange traded fund, comprising 22 stocks. The ETF saw bids of nearly Rs 32,000 crore coming in, with foreign institutional investors (FIIs) bidding for one-third of the money.The portion reserved for retail investors was subscribed 1.45 times; retirement funds 1.50 times and non-institutional investors (NIIs) and qualified institutional buyers (QIBs) seven times.The state-owned companies or PSUs that are part of the new Bharat ETF 22 include ONGC, IOC, SBI, BPCL, Coal India and Nalco. The other CPSEs on the list are Bharat Electronics, Engineers India, NBCC, NTPC, NHPC, SJVNL, GAIL, PGCIL and NLC India. Only three public sector banks – SBI, Indian Bank and Bank of Baroda – figure in the Bharat-22 index. Interestingly there are 3 private sector companies like Axis Bank, L&T and ITC which are a part of this ETF.The Bharat-22 exchange traded fund is meant for investing for the next generation, not for the short term, said Nimesh Shah, managing director and chief executive officer of ICICI Prudential Mutual Fund. The fund is managing the portfolio of the 22 blue chip stocks. "If you think the government is managing these companies well, this is the index to bet on," Shah said in an earlier conversation with BloombergQuint.






With inputs from PTI
title: Bharat 22 ETF Rises 3.6% On Stock Market Debut
